title: Response to the Riot article about their disappointments with Shen gamplay.
body:
I really think Shen should be an AD/AP binary pathway champion.
Where his abilities are designed so that building AD turns him into an AD Assassin and building AP makes him damage but gives him more utility (i.e. taunt duration scale with AP) - which should work well with tank items.

In addition building one path reduces the effectiveness of the abilities tied to the other path. For example, building AD reduces taunt duration and in contrast building AP is a far weaker option of dealing damage.

By design, building both AD and AP on him aka hybrid should not be rewarded so as to _balance_ his state. We wouldn't want tank assassins in the Rift now would we?

replies.body:
Yeah it would be nice to bring back some of the diversity old Shen had.

To be honest I don't really know why Shen was reworked in the first place. He wasn't overly problematic and got plenty of pro-play, while still being simple and easy.

Sadly, when **Riot Meddler** pointed out Shen's problems in the [State of the Season](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/state-season-coming-mid-season) announcement it didn't seem like it will be fixed or changed soon from what he said :(
Shen is perfect how he is!!!!!!
